Want to get in on the ground floor with a small but growing art marketing company that is launching another exciting business line? Because you are an organized self-starter, a quick learner, and have a knack for internet and social media, we want you to help us methodically grow the business. You have other time-consuming things going on in your life right now, which is just perfect for us. You will start with a limited number of hours with maximum flexibility as you work from home.
As our Digital Management Assistant, you will:

Take care of our internet sites and social media platforms.
Lead the creation of our visual and textual materials for organic and paid promotions.
Create and manage our campaigns with social media and Google.
Organize and manage sales leads and follow-up.
Provide executive assistance and administrative support.

Requirements:

Strong organizational skills
Excellent internet and social media competencies
Mother-tongue English (no Hebrew is required)
Flexible hours
Suitable Work-from-Home environment
Good to have: Sales/customer service background, graphic design or content writing experience, other languages, and/or familiarity with CRM programs

Details :

Initial Hours: 2 hours/day, expected to grow quickly to a 20 hours/week and more. Israeli daytime hours, with some evening hour work.
Base Salary: 31 NIS/hour + incentives that should more than double your base after a few months of excellent performance.

Send your CV today to: avinoamcohen99@gmail.comShow more Report

At Mobileye, we foster a hybrid-friendly environment, combining work from office and home.
Which team will you join?
Mobileye is the world leader in automotive and driving assistance systems, developing the world's most advanced software technologies and hardware architectures.
Our group is located in Haifa and is responsible for enabling deep learning and computer vision algorithms on the Mobileye platform.
We develop the software architecture system and tools to enable state-of-the-art algorithms to run efficiently in vehicles – contributing to saving lives and enabling autonomous vehicles.
We use cutting-edge technology stack and design methodologies, to achieve optimized and robust solutions in order to support different customers across the globe.
Check out our technology in action: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=50NPqEla0CQ
What will your job look like:
As a C++ developer, you will join the Mobileye Application team, a new forming team in Haifa. This is an exciting opportunity to write and design an application from scratch!

The car application controls the main execution flow of various software components running of Mobileye chip, in addition it also controls many sensors and manage their inputs, sensors such as camera, lidar, radar, car signals (speed, etc.)
The application combines all the different inputs and feeds them into the different algorithms, in order to create a worldview for the car.

The project is challenging both in its real-time complexity of a system with multiple various sensors and being of part of overall automotive car system architecture.
Doing all of that while working on highly optimized and well-designed software.
The main application is developed in C++ for Linux.
All you need is:
BSc/MSc in Computer Science/ Electrical Engineering with computer science chain
Knowledge of C/C++ with practical experience - significant Advantage
OOP basics
Git/Linux basics
Mobileye changes the way we drive, from preventing accidents to semi and fully autonomous vehicles. If you are an excellent, bright, hands-on person with a passion to make a difference come to lead the revolution!Show more Report

A TLV-based startup that’s on a mission to change the work experience for 80% of the world’s global workforce is looking for a talented, experienced and creative Art Director with managerial experience to build creative capacity at scale within the company.

Apply here to help shape the future of work!

About This Role:
As an Art Director you will develop and execute a creative strategy to meet the company’s business goals and support its growing marketing efforts. This includes establishing the studio in-house to support all creative needs. Focus areas cover motion graphics, directing photo and video shoots, illustrations, website, landing pages and the creation of digital assets at scale, OOH marketing and traditional marketing.
Ownership & Responsibilities:
Recruit and operate an in-house studio
Craft a creative business strategy aligned with business goals supporting an ever-growing marketing budget across multiple channels (acquisition oriented)
Lead the marketing creative team and manage the creative process from A to Z, collaborate with the Content, Marketing and Product teams
Set the visual tone/direction of campaigns to build concepts and bring them to life
Responsible for delivering marketing assets at scale for a variety of channels: banners, landing pages, video ads, newsletters, blogs, social posts, etc.
Turn creative briefs into beautiful marketing assets
Prioritize projects and work on tight deadlines
Be on top of the marketing assets performance, initiate data-driven AB tests and always strive to improve conversion rates
Work closely with external vendors, stakeholders and partners
Qualifications:
Proven experience in building and managing a studio / a significant creative team
5+ Years of experience as a designer or related positions in a marketing agency - a must
Experience with motion graphics, directing video shoots, and digital marketing assets
Team player with the ability to work with strategists, data scientists and account teams in a fast-paced environment
Understand how to scale ideas for global deliverables
Experience designing for different audiences (B2B, consumer, enterprise)
Possess strong art direction/design skills
Follow brand guidelines and work within a design system
Proven experience working across teams, both in leading projects, and collaborating on work
Attention to details and high sensitivity to aesthetic
Critical thinking and storytelling skills
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Familiarity with online marketing metrics
Portfolio of beautiful, compelling digital and brand-oriented workShow more Report

EX LIBRIS– Who are we?
Ex Libris, Part of Clarivate, is a global EdTech (Education Technology) industry, leader. We serve some of the most prestigious academic institutions and research Universities around the world, with a total of over 7,500 customers in 90 countries.
Our SaaS solutions help universities transform academic libraries, maximize the impact of research activities, enhance teaching and learning, and drive student engagement and success. For more information about Ex Libris, see our website, and join us on Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and Twitter.
We are looking for a Product Manager to join our Cross Products Team in Jerusalem. This is an amazing opportunity to work on bringing Linked Data into the Top Academic Libraries in the world. The team consists of five people and is reporting to the Director of Cross Product and Operations. We have a great skill set in SaaS products and we would love to speak with you if you have skills in building data-driven products.
About You – experience, education, skills, and accomplishments
Bachelor’s degree in one of the following fields: Information Science, Data Science, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or Exact Science or equivalent education
Work experience in your field, plus 1-2 years as a product manager
Strong understanding of complex computers systems in a cloud environment
Strong orientation for all aspects of data – analysis, modeling, scale, advanced processing
Experience managing basic customer questions and concerns for their product(s).
Ability to collaborate across teams to manage product development.
Excellent English
Has a working understanding of business drivers and key issues.
Must possess the ability to gain domain knowledge in the position.
It would be great if you also had . . .
Professional experience in a library setting.
MBA
MLIS - Master of Library and Information Science
What will you be doing in this role?
Product Requirements – Provide clear and measurable product requirements and make trade-off recommendations between implementation and functionality.
Product Delivery – manages the development and launch of new features and functionality through the entire product development lifecycle process from concept through implementation and release. (For full product, or significant product features)
Customer Research – Participate in leading focus groups, customer surveys, and user testing to inform product priorities. Monitors key product analytics to inform development priorities.
Product Roadmap – Under direction, understands market priorities and works with Engineering to identify trade-offs. Drives activities/user store products and deliver the product to market t, according to product roadmap. Prioritizes and sequences product features to meet market demands.
Product Strategy - Internalize product strategy such that it informs market requirements and feature prioritization.
The product you will be developing
Linked Data is a new technology we would like to leverage across the core products of Ex Libris, Alma, and Primo. Using this technology, we want to provide a whole new end-to-end experience from a global collaborative cataloging platform through the best-in-class library management system over the cloud (Alma) to the robust discovery system (Primo). We aim to utilize this new way of working with the data as a graph database, integrated with new AI services.
This is a long-term area that is at the core of Ex Libris's strategy.
About the Team
The cross-products and operations team has five people working with multiple product managers and development teams in various areas such as UX and Accessibility, Analytics, Security and Privacy as well as core features of the Higher Education Platform. These people are veterans in their areas and work collaboratively within the team and externally including other groups from the wider cooperate of Clarivate. The people on the team are based in Israel.
Hours of Work / More important information for you:
Our base is in the Jerusalem, Israel office, working in a hybrid model
This is a full-time position.
Occasional travel is required.
Why Ex-Libris?
At Ex Libris, we value our employees and are striving to create the perfect balance between work and home life. Join us to be part of a family-like environment; enjoy our unique culture and benefits. Be part of a thriving, productive community helping change the future of higher education with the state-of-the-art technology from Ex Libris.
At Ex Libris, we work hard and have fun doing it!
At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.Show more Report

Founded in 2009 and 100% self-funded to this day, Natural Intelligence is a leader in online multi-vertical marketplaces. Our global brands, Top10.com and BestMoney.com, help millions worldwide make informed decisions every day. Our proprietary platform, xMatch, harnesses AI and ML technologies in order to help consumers make easier choices, and find the right products and services tailored to their needs.
We are seeking a highly talented & motivated Creative Art to join our Growth Department. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced creative person who is in love with creating unforgettable images and holistic concepts that make a powerful impact.
Responsibilities
Design unique images in the social media field (Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok, etc.).
Create storyboards for UGC and Commercial videos.
Manage A/B testing processes from A to Z by working closely with campaign managers.
Constant analysis of trends in the social media field and ability to implement these insights in the design you create.
Work closely with the Copywriter, Design Studio, and Video Studio while creating sharp and data-driven creatives.
Making a vertical-based overview and utilizing creative data in order to monetize the creative assets results.
Requirements:

English proficiency, both spoken and written.
3 years of experience as an art director in a big advertising agency.
Previous experience in creating storyboards and social images.
Experience in creating a campaign for social media such as Facebook and Tik Tok.
Ability to work in a large team.
Experience in growth/performance marketing - a big plus.
Working with a fintech customer - a big plus.
Only suitable CVs will be considered.Show more Report
